feed.title: SAP Community - Settlement Management
feed.subtitle: Settlement Management Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Source of data for Settlement Doc Pricing
entry.content:
My scenario is for External Commissions on Billing Docs paid but I think my question is not unique to that scenario.

I want to set RCS1 Commission and RCA1 Accrual condition types in my contract to apply rates based on Customer Price Group and Material Price group from the sales transaction items.  (These are just examples, we could consider any of the sales item fields that we might use in SD pricing.)  I can create the tables and access sequence and assign condition types to groups etc, so I am able to define these conditions in the contract the way i want them.  I have reference doc (Sales Order) and reference item as split criteria in Settlement so each settlement item relates to one sales order item.  However,  when it comes to settlement document pricing, the analysis tells me that no values were found for these fields and so the condition records were not found.   I know these fields are not on settlement item WBRP.  Do they need to be?

First question: is the control to populate the settlement item with data from the business volume in the Split Criteria for settlement?  It seems that these fields only get filled if they are part of the split criteria.

Second question:  Do I need to append the settlement item table to store additional fields for pricing or does pricing read them from the business volume table or CDS view?

If I need to be able to price my settlement items on fields that aren't available on the item, do I append the business volume table, the CDS view, the settlement item or all of these?

Thank you for any guidance you can give.

entry.title: Incorrect scale level picked during final settlement for quantity-based rebate condition
entry.content:
Hello,

In a condition contract using condition type RES1 with Base Scale & condition table 163, we’ve maintained quantity-based scales for two materials: 

Material A: 1 PC = 1%, 5 PC = 2%, 10 PC = 3%

Material B: 20 PC = 2%, 30 PC = 4%, 40 PC = 6%

An invoice contains 7 PC of Material A & 32 PC of Material B. However, during  final settlement, the system incorrectly applies 3% for Material A & 6% for Material B. instead of the expected 2% & 4% resp.

This issue does not occur when only one condition record exists in the contract. Why is the system picking incorrect scale values when multiple condition records are maintained?

Thank you

entry.title: Budget exceeds error through ko88 on some IO.
entry.content:
When I run the internal order settlement through ko88, it gives a budget exceed error on some internal orders, while when I run these internal order alone, it shows there is no line item found in SAP.

In actual there is no activity performed on these internal order then why the error occurs.

Please help me in resolving the issue. Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Cummulative business volume for scale basis-Settlement Management
entry.content:
XYZ is Kitchen equipment Retailer. Their business runs on SAP S/4 2023. Business pay Royalties to designer based on customer billing value. The agreement is to have Royalties rate based on cumulative billing value. This rate is applied on monthly billing value.

 

Historical sales = £50k

Agreed tier with partner

 

From

To

Rate

£1k

£100k

4%

£101k

£150k

3%

 

 

 

July

Aug

Sep

Monthly sales vol

£40k

£30k

£20k

**bleep** Sales value

£90k

£120k

£140k

Rate applicable

4%

3%

3%

Royalties accrual

£1.6k

£1k

£0.6k

 

Quarterly royalties payment (First week of October) = £1.6k + £1k + £0.6k = £3.2k

 

We would like to enable Royalties settlement management solution in SAP S/4.

entry.title: Condition Contract - Delta Accrual
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am creating multi period Condition Contract and would like to perform accrual on monthly basis. However, the accrual document should be independent from each settlement calendar (do-not using cumulative approach).

i found the configuration about cumulative and partial, however it did not work for accrual. looks like it only partial approach only works for partial settlement.

Any idea how to perform non-cumulative accrual via condition contract?

Thank you

Hendry

entry.title: Commission Contract: Copy Control for Conditions
entry.content:
During contract creation we maintain rates for condition type RCS1, sometimes using scales.  This works fine.  Requirement from Accounting team is to maintain accrual condition type RCA1 exactly the same way as RCS1, to ensure accruals are as accurate as possible.   When using the copy function, it is not possible to include the scale levels.  If I select one (or all) the system displays error W_CB237 "You have selected an incorrect line".

Is it possible to change this to allow copying of scale levels for a condition record?

Thank you

entry.title: Condition Contract with Quantity Scale - Settlement Adjustment
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am working on a Condition Contracts with quantity scale. Is there any option to manually add additional quantity to business volume quantity identified in the business volume? Example:

 

 RateCurrencyUnitUoMFrom To 
RES11$1LB0999LB
 2$1LB100099999LB
     100000999999999LB

Due to master data or some other issue, if the quantity for the billing document is not captured in the business volume, is there a way to add the quantity into the business volume. In case of Value Contracts, we can use REBD condition type in the condition contract to add Delta Business volume to the contract. In the similar way, do we have any process to add additional quantity to the business volume so that the right scale level is picked while processing the rebate settlement.

Regards

Hari

entry.title: Commission Contract: Accrual Basis vs Commission Basis
entry.content:
We are engaged in a discovery process for External Commissions scenario, based on best practice scope item 2TT.   

We have a business requirement to accrue for commissions on sales invoices created but to settle commissions only against sales invoices paid.  In other words, we want Accruals to behave like we are using contract type 0CS1 and Settlements (Partial and Final) to behave like we are using contract type 0CS3.   We anticipate using contract type 0CS3.

A simple view of a potential solution would be to somehow enable Settlement Doc Type 0C41 (Delta Accruals) to use business volume table VWB2_VBRKVBRP_7 and Doc Type 0C11 (Commission) to use business volume table VWB2_VBRKVBRP_9 while keeping all other processes and behaviors the same.    Accruals should be reversed based on the value of the settlements.

I am seeking guidance and suggestions for how to approach a solution like this and what else we should consider.  It seems like it might be a fairly common requirement but there is no standard solution for it.  So I wonder what technical reasons there might be for not doing this.

Thanks

David

entry.title: Profit Center in Settlement Document | Settlement Management
entry.content:
Is it possible to redetermine Profit Center while creating Settlement document (WB2R_SC/WB2R_SV or manual creation) through a Custom Logic bypassing the SAP standard logic.
Field : Settlement Doc- Line Item - Account Assignment - Profit Center

We tried using the below options
Option 1. Using transfer manager
Option2. Copy Billing Document Profit Center to Settlement document.

Issues faced in the above options:

Option 1- Tried using Transfer Events 23, 25, 39 which has KOMLFP - PRCTR in target structure passing fixed value which doesn't work. Transfer Event - 65 only works for manual creation without material in line item, not via WB2R_SC.
Are there any other events that can be used for WB2R_SC/SV to re-determine the Profit Center.
Can we put a custom logic in here to determine the profit center?

Option 2-
Can I copy Billing Profit Center to Settlement docs, for each line items ?
Currently we notice, although it's coming from Billing document, but it only considers settlement Line Item 1 - Billing Document and passes the same for all line items in settlement doc.

For ex. if Settlement doc no. XXXX has Line item 1, 2 which was created for multiple billing documents, having different Profit Centers - Line item 1's PRCTR is copied to all.
Line item 2 created for billing doc having a different PRCTR is not considered.

In the existing system the profit center in the sales billing document is being determined from a custom logic.

entry.title: Disable the automatic settlement of production/Process orders through event base in our SAP system
entry.content:
I would like to know if it is possible to stop or disable the automatic settlement of production orders through event base in our SAP Public cloud system. Currently, production orders are being automatically settled during the period-end closing process, but for certain business cases, we would like to either control this manually or exclude specific orders or order types from being auto-settled.

My production order type dependanted  parameter change manual settlement.After create a production order using changed production type and confirmed.

In this order have price variance but system don't calculate price variance, For refarence i have attach a screenshot.

Please provide a solution how to calculate price variance.

entry.title: Extra line items with zero value in settlement document
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are facing below issue in settlment document.

We are using Variant characteristics in our condition contracts. When we create a settlment document, against an accrual document, system is creating additional line itmes in the settlement document with REA2 value.

For example:  we have 5 line items in accrual document, the settlement docuemnt is creating 10 line items, 5 line itmes as in accrual document, remaining 5 line items with ZERO value and only with REA2 value. 

Appreciate your thouhgts on, why system is behaving like this.

Sunny

entry.title: Multiple Delta Accrual on the Same Date
entry.content:
We have a condition contract that has a validity of 1 Jan 2025 to 30 June 2025. A delta accrual was executed on the 30th June 2025 and posted correctly.

 However, we have discovered that there are some billing documents that had not been posted and these documents have a billing date of 30 June 2025. Since we had executed the delta accrual for this date we can’t run another delta accrual for the same date.

 My question is what is the process to get the “outstanding” billing documents included in the accrual?

entry.title: Manual Settlement in Sales Rebate
entry.content:
Hi All, 

i have requirement where seller must pay deposit upfront before rebate program is initiated. 

i am planning to create manual settlement with reference to created condition contract. Manual settlement document has been successfully created (partial settlement type) with positive amount (item category = standard). Accounting document is generated as per expectation (A/R on credit side).

the issue occurs during final settlement. the expectation is the manual settlement amount act as deduction of final settlement amount (expectation: positive value in final settlement document). However, condition type RES2 (Rebate PartSettl Rev) shows as negative value hence adding the rebate amount.

any idea how to make sure the condition type RES2 shows as positive value hence deducting the final rebate amount?

Thanks

Hendry

entry.title: Settelment Management with multiple scale level for material groups dosn't work as expected
entry.content:
Hi there!

I have a problem with an contract i created for a customer. 

Selection criteria: 

InclusiveCustomer A  
InclusiveBonus Group 10 Material Group 001here Material A
Inclusive Bonus Group 10Material Group 002

here Material B

Condition: 

Customer ABonus Group 10Material Group 001Percentage1%Base Scale 500€
Customer ABonus Group 10Material Group 002Percentage2%Base Scale 500€

 

Volume: 

Customer A
Material A : 1000 €

Material B: 200€

 

Expection for Final Settelment: 
Material A : 1000 € * 1% = 10 € Bonus
Material B: 200 €  -> no Bonus because it is unter the scale of 500€.

But, I get an Bonus for Material A and B. Why do I get an bonus for Material B?

entry.title: How to combine two vendor's business volume and split the settlement in CCM
entry.content:
Is it possible to use CCM handle this rebate case : We have two suppliers that belong to the same group. When we calculate the business volume, we need to combine the procurement amounts of these two suppliers for calculation. However, during the subsequent settlement process, we need to record the accounts separately based on the volume contributed by each of the two suppliers.

 

Settlement Management

entry.title: No message determination schema entered in settlement document type 0S34
entry.content:
Hi Experts @Lakshmipathi @GauthierVictor @Chris1973 @

When we are trying to create/generate output document, we are getting message Message No. WS615 " No message determination schema entered in settlement document type 0S34". We are able to generate output document for other settlement documents like 0S12,0S14,0S32 etc. but not for 0S34. We have maintained OPD (BRF+) parameters for 0S34 document type also but still we are getting this error. Error screenshot attached for reference. Not able to generate manually extras--> messages--> edit menu also. Kindly share your inputs to resolve the issue.

Settlement Management  SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Rebate and Royalties in SAP S/4
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are on SAP S/4 2022 and we are looking to enable royalties using settlement management.We give royalties to the designer based on product sales. The business volume should be billing amount to customers for those specific products plus rebate. Business also give rebate to customer however it is offline. 

I think, to bring Rebate in royalties consideration, we need to enable Rebate via settlement management.

Here are the steps which we have followed:

1. Condition contract for Rebate 0S10.

2. Condition contract for Royalties 0RS1.

3. Sales order to billing flow, where we have captured Rebate and Royalties in condition type ( for accruals).

4. Ran settlement for Rebate. It has generated a settlement document.

5.Ran settlement for Royalties. It includes the billing document, however it does not consider the Rebate settlement. While running the business volume, we could not see rebate settlement in the list.

Observation- Rebate settlement document does not appear in VBRK. I think, to include in Royalties settlement, it should create SD billing document. Am i correct?

Am i missing any steps here?

 

Regards,

Sumit

entry.title: How to split settlement document based on customer and supplier vat registration number
How can I settle a single customer in multiple customer condition contract 0S02
entry.content: We have a requirement to settle a single customer (partial settlement) from a multiple customer condition contract 0S02. I tried using the Tcode WB2R_DOC_ENTRY but getting an error as No manual settlement documents allowed for contract type 0S02.  Kindly requesting SAP experts help.

entry.title: Manual Accrual getting reversed at the time of Delta Accrual
entry.content:
I have posted a Manual Delta Accrual of 300 $ as part of the data migration activity.

Later we have transactions in S4 leading to an accrual of 400 $, but when this accrual is posted by a Delta Accrual run, the 300$ posted by the manul delta accrual is reversed with condition RED2.

Is there a way to stop this reversal? I want the accruals both manual and by system to be reversed only at the time of settlement run.
